item.title: Qwest Offers Synchronous Service Transport For Massive Bandwidth
item.description:
Need to move massive amounts of data quickly and reliably? Within a building or campus, fiber optic cables provide sufficient speed and capacity. However, for longer distances, you need robust carrier services. Quest’s Synchronous Service Transport (SST) offers a solution. SST utilizes fiber optics and SONET (Synchronous Optical Network) to provide high-speed, point-to-point data transfer. SONET, a dependable carrier service based on Time Division Multiplexing (TDM), was initially designed for telephone companies and later adopted by large organizations requiring extensive bandwidth...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/qwest-offers-synchronous-service-transport-for-massive-bandwidth/
